history.text: I enjoyed the movie, what did you think of it?
Home Alone was one of my favorite movies as a kid. I absolutely loved it. I also feel it deserved a little more on the Rotten Tomatoes.

I agree. It was quick paced, well-acted, 
and allowed me to "suspend my disbelief" :)
I thought Joe Pesci was especially funny, but I like him in most things.
Did you like Macaulay in it?

I don't feel that the first half was "flat and unsurprising." It had the witty banter among the children. It honestly made me feel like I could relate in a sense. Children being stuck in a big family and being completely ignored seems about right.
Joe Pesci is absolutely hilarious.
Maccaulay Culkin couldn't have been better chosen for the part of Kevin.
I agree that the first half was entertaining. I rarely had the house to myself as a kid and loved the concept.
In reality though, what kid is going to "relish" in being home alone with no way to contact your parents. They would probably be scared out of their mind.
Good point, although after the initial shock I think a lot of kids would settle in and do what they had to.
Normally that wouldn't necessitate bashing burglers, but that was what made the movie an adventure!
All the booby traps in the movie me remind me of all the pranks my step-father used to play on us as kids.
Ha! You must have had an exciting childhood!
I loved it although I do wish it was a little more suspenseful.
I honestly think they should do another movie with Kevin leaving his kids behind.
Oh, I think that would be fun!

I do usually pay attention to movie ratings when deciding to watch one, but will sometimes ignore bad ones if the plot sounds especially interesting. D
o you go by ratings?
My husband does. He tells me I watch some dumb stuff. I try to, but if it looks interesting to me I will watch it.
I don't see a lot of stuff in the movie as realistic though. It is funny if you want a laugh though.
Yes, I'm prepared for a fair amount of non-realism in movies, although I do think that basing them in reality before flying off into the wild is a good technique.
Sorry to break character here, but isn't it supposed to automatically advance to the next movie after we've completed 3 "turns"?
I think so but I read 15 times also. Maybe it wants us to respond 15 times with a total of 3 different sets of pages.
Oh my. We've already spent 20 minutes just on this one.
Okay, just looked it up and it says 15 times in total, 3-5 times per movie.
Yeah. I know. I read it again though. I think something might be wrong with it.
I agreee. The movie page keeps appearing to reload but its always Home Alone. Do you know how to email the requester?
It just popped up for me with the new one. Did you get it yet?
I can email you the new documents if you would like?
ohh....maybe it's been popping up with new information about home alone....this one says "this is the end of document"
That is it.
No, not ready to share my email, but shall we discuss this last one?
The Christmas day scene was great. Disappointment followed by elation is always a good ploy!

No problem. Just thought that might work, but sense we both have it now we are good. Yes, number 2 and 3 are the new ones. Honestly, what person is going to realize their kid is missing in the middle of the flight? It is like forgetting you had a kid to begin with. lol
Honestly, this day and time they would have figured out he was at home and made more of an effort to get in contact with him.
The Christmas Day scene was for sure good, but I feel the actors could have shown a little more emotion. You loose your kid, a Mom is probably going to be a lot more hysterical than she was.
I was able to buy into the premise because my aunt actually forgort one of her 7 kids at home when she went to the store. LOL
He was fine, and it was only about 10 minutes before my aunt came back.
True about the hysteria. I liked the casting of the mom, though, because the actress was believable in her distracted callousness

Oh my. I remember my Mother was gone for a little while and I got off the bus and still in Kindergarten. I was totally hysterical it being the first time I was home by myself. I didn't know any different. It is funny to me now though. My little sister was in Kindergarten as well when my Mom was late getting off work. We had tons of Core of Engineer property behind our home that was part of the State Park with miles of woods. She got off the bus and left her backpack by the front door and left all the doors open. My Mom thought something terrible happened to her and she lost it. It turns out she was next door at the neighbors and they were watching her.
Oh my god, as a mom I would have lost it too!
The burglers were pretty hilarious throughout, and their bungling made it the comedy movie that it was, rathern than the creepy thriller it could have been.
The bit about flooding the houses was great
and that that's what made the other houses identifiable to the cops
Very true. I think my husband has rubbed off on me. Every movie we watch that we watch that has military in it, he is like that isn't realistic.It seems I am doing the same. lol
Also the polka band bus was pretty inspired. The mom actually did pull out all the stops to get back.

LOL. We will become harsh
 movie critics yet!
I can relate to houses flooding. Every time we went on vacation our house flooded. I mean every single time, talk about creepy!!!
That IS creepy! Bad pipes?
I wonder which other movies Chris Columbus has done? I would like to check them out and see how they compare to this one.
No. Weird stuff did happen even when we were home. It still gives me the creeps.

Ah, I have become a believer in the paranormal. Hsunted Home Alone would be a scarier movie.

Wow, great response, thanks! OH, he did the 
Harry Potter movies? nice!
The Help was superb.
I haven't seen it. I might watch it tonight.
I can see the similarity of his style to Home Alone in these.
It's great.

uid1response.feedback:
I misunderstood the instructions and thought there would be 4 different movies rather than 4 sections about 1 movie. But I felt we still did a good job of discussing main points. If you're not satisfied with my work I'd really appreciate a chance for a redo. Thank you!
Susan

uid2response.feedback: Issues with the documents switching over.
